item.title: fluffysox add a quote by James Madison
item.description: "No nation could preserve its freedom in the midst of continual warfare." -- James Madison

item.title: fluffysox add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A good friend will always stab you in the front." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: fluffysox add a quote by H.G. Wells
item.description: "If you fell down yesterday, stand up today." -- H.G. Wells

item.title: fluffysox add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it." -- Aristotle

item.title: fluffysox add a quote by James Madison
item.description: "The means of defence agst. foreign danger, have been always the instruments of tyranny at home." -- James Madison

item.title: fluffysox add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: fluffysox add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: fluffysox add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "We are not necessarily doubting that God will do the best for us; we are wondering how painful the best will turn out to be." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: fluffysox add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "She's the sort of woman who lives for others - you can tell the others by their hunted expression." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: fluffysox add a quote by C. S. Lewis
item.description: "Of all tyrannies, a tyranny sincerely exercised for the good of its victims may be the most oppressive. It would be better to live under robber barons than under omnipotent moral busybodies. The robber baron's cruelty may sometimes sleep, his cupidity may at some point be satiated; but those who torment us for our own good will torment us without end for they do so with the approval of their own conscience." -- C. S. Lewis
